meanings.def: to have sex and produce young
examples: Many animals breed only at certain times of the year.

meanings.def: to keep animals or plants in order to produce young ones for a particular purpose
examples: breed something (for/as something) The rabbits are bred for their long coats.
Greyhounds were originally bred as hunting dogs.
the first panda to be bred in captivity
breed from something She's a lovely cat. Will you breed from her?
dogs that are bred for their fighting ability
fish that have been selectively bred for their appearance
The otters were bred in captivity and then released into the wild.

meanings.def: to be the cause of something
examples: Nothing breeds success like success.

meanings.def: to educate somebody in a particular way as they are growing up
examples: Fear of failure was bred into him at an early age.

meanings.def: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education
examples: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.

meanings.def: to have a lot of babies in a short space of time
examples: These rodents breed like rabbits.

meanings.def: knowing somebody/something very well may cause you to lose respect for them/it

idioms.def: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education
examples: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.

idioms.def: to have a lot of babies in a short space of time
examples: These rodents breed like rabbits.

idioms.def: knowing somebody/something very well may cause you to lose respect for them/it

meanings.def: a particular type of animal that has been developed by people in a certain way, especially a type of dog, cat or farm animal
examples: Labradors and other large breeds of dog
a breed of cattle/sheep
This breed is used for both milk and meat production.
Three years later the breed was officially recognized.
a new breed of dairy cattle
He represents a new breed of politician.
Health workers are a breed apart (= different and special) in their commitment and dedication to duty.
a new breed of international criminals
It takes a special breed of person to be a surgeon.
